p: Based on their ethnopharmacological use, Eriosema species aroused the interest of the scientific community. In line with this, many studies have been carried out aiming at evaluating or confirming the therapeutic potential of species from this genus. As depicted in Table 4, extracts and constituents from Eriosema species are shown to be responsible for a wide range of pharmacological activities such as aphrodisiac, anti-diarrheal, anti-oxidant, anti-microbial, anti-diabetic/hypoglycemic and estrogenic properties.
